titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I finished the article, but not at all to my satisfaction

. If I had had a month of uninterrupted work to bestow upon it, I think I could have produced something of real value. As it is I turn out a crude fragment indicating the lines of an argument but not really setting forth the argument
. Haste, and all that haste implies, inadequacy of illustration, lack of finish &c, marks all my work.
I live in a squalid hustle really, though I reside in the depths of the country!

Binstead from Mordiford lunched here, & afterwards went round the garden & counselled us as to the fruit trees it would be advisable to plant in the vacant places whence the old barren ones had been removed.
